description.value: https://www.cms.gov/Medicare/Coding/place-of-service-codes/Place_of_Service_Code_Set.html . The link takes one to the Place of Service list as an html document; it is not a file to which an IG can be bound. The code set is owned by CMS and is available for use.
Reason codes used to interpret the adjudication denial reason. X12 CARC + CMS RARC
Reason codes used to interpret the adjudication denial reason. X12 CARC + CMS RARC

div.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

tr.td: The total submitted amount for the claim or group or line item.
Amount of the change which is considered for adjudication.
Amount deducted from the eligible amount prior to adjudication.
The amount the insured individual pays, as a set percentage of the cost of covered medical services, as an out-of-pocket payment to the provider. Example: Insured pays 20% and the insurer pays 80%.
The portion of the cost of this service that was deemed not eligible by the insurer because the service or member was not covered by the subscriber contract.
The reduction in the payment amount to reflect the carrier as a secondary payor.
The amount paid by the patient at the point of service.
The amount paid to the provider.
The amount of the member's liability.
Price paid for the drug excluding mfr or other discounts. It typically is the sum of the following components: ingredient cost, dispensing fee, sales tax, and vaccine administration

description.value: Values for EOB.item.adjudication.category, as per Igor

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Claim Information Category v0.2.0 (CodeSystem)

tr.td: Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
Indicates the in network or out of network payment status of the claim.
The date the claim was received by the payer.
High level classification of services into logical grouping.
UB04 (Form Locator 4) type of bill code provides specific information for payer purposes. The first digit of the three-digit number denotes the type of facility.
UB04 (Form Locator 4) type of bill code provides specific information for payer purposes. The second digit classifies the type of care (service classification) being billed.

UB04 (Form Locator 4) type of bill code provides specific information for payer purposes. The third digit identifies the frequency of the bill for a specific course of treatment or inpatient confinement.
Identifies the place where the patient was identified as needing admission to a facility. This is a two position code mapped from the standard values for the UB-04 Source of Admission code (FL-15).

Priority of the admission. Information located on (UB04 Form Locator 14). For example, an admission type of elective indicates that the patient's condition permitted time for medical services to be scheduled.
Patients status as of the discharge date for a facility stay.
Code indicating the location, such as inpatient, outpatient facility, office, or home health agency, where this service was performed.
Number of days supply of medication dispensed by the pharmacy.
Prescriber's instruction regarding substitution of generic equivalents or order to dispense the specific prescribed medication.
The number fill of the current dispensed supply (0, 1, 2, etc.).
Whether the prescription was transmitted as an electronic prescription, by phone, by fax, or as a written paper copy
Whether the plan adjudicated the claim as a brand or generic drug.

description.value: Claim Information Category - Used as the discriminator for supportingInfo
